summary: Most requested frontend pages and React Query hooks appear to be implemented, along with a single-actor Motoko backend containing per-user (Principal-keyed) storage types for transfers, cards, loans, insurance, and EMI plans. The diff also introduces additional, non-requested authorization/admin-token initialization and a user profile setup flow.

hallucinated_features.description: Custom access-control/authorization layer with admin secret token initialization (beyond Internet Identity-only auth requirement).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only asks for Internet Identity sign-in/out and user-scoped persistence; it explicitly lists no third-party auth providers. Adding an admin-token based access-control initialization is extra and not requested.
evidence: backend/main.mo (imports authorization/MixinAuthorization and authorization/access-control; permission checks with Runtime.trap("Unauthorized...") )

hallucinated_features.description: User profile collection and mandatory profile setup dialog (name/email/phone) gated on authentication.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest requirements do not include any user profile feature or requirement to collect personal details; adding a profile setup dialog and backend profile storage is extra scope.
evidence: frontend/src/components/AppLayout.tsx (uses useGetCallerUserProfile and displays user initial/profile)

hallucinated_features.description: Claim that user data is 'encrypted and stored securely on the blockchain' in user-facing login marketing copy.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by the BuildRequest and could be misleading; the diff does not provide evidence of encryption being implemented.
evidence: frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.tsx (feature description: 'Your data is encrypted and stored securely on the blockchain')
